summary: The memorandum from H. Clark Schor, Chief of the Plans and Review Group within the Central Cover Staff, addresses a request from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) by providing additional information on the contents of CCS files related to specific individuals and entities. It details the availability of documents concerning George DeMohrenschildt, Leo Cherne, William Harvey, and others, as well as entities like the International Rescue Committee and Wackenhut Corporation, while noting the absence of records for certain items.
key_findings: Documents related to George DeMohrenschildt include contact reports and a trace request memorandum from 1963.
Leo Cherne's documents cover his role in providing cover for a NOC officer in Paris and his association with the Research Institute of America.
William Harvey's documents pertain to his cover arrangements during his tenure with the Agency from 1947 to 1967.
The International Rescue Committee's documents address the Agency's non-use of IRC and FOIA requests from 1962 to 1976.
No records were found in CCS for Alexander Rorke, Southern Research Corporation, and certain communications involving Richard Helms, James Angleton, and Raymond Rocca.
The Wackenhut Corporation has a significant number of documents (100-150) from 1963 to 1977, primarily concerning contacts with its officials.
